The Cult of Alistair

Overview

History

Founder: John Alistair

When: Before Recorded History

The Cult of Alistair were the original inhabitants of South Western Phoria. The Cult lived in the Black Ridge Mountains, north of later day Curagoth. They were a peaceful group close to nature with the understanding of balance and preservation.


As time passed, more travelers came and settled south of Black Ridge Mountains and slowly changed the face of the land. Trees were cut down by the hundreds to build new houses and for clearing farm land. Somewhere during this period, The Cult of Alistair became corrupted. A former reclusive society went to the extreme to stop the foreigners from damaging the land further and to preserve what game was left.


In time, The Cult of Alistair began raiding small villages and gaining converts by the sword as well as taking captives for later sacrifices. Sacrifice became more and more prevalent within their society changing from animals to humans around the same time. It was said that Alistair was known to possess the powers of the shapeshifter. He and his band of men could take advantage of the wolf for speed and the bear for strength.


The Cult of Alistair did well deterring further travelers until the Kvali came. Too many well armed and trained men overwhelmed the people of Black Ridge Mountain destroying their center of culture. The Cult could do very little as some escaped and most died. Alistair was never found, however, many journals were found written by the Arch Bishop as well as detailed historical information regarding rituals and daily life. Alistair had numerous predictions of the future supposedly gathered by reading the flames rising from sacrifices. He predicted that three kingdoms would replace the ancient men and in turn fall to the giants. Much of his writings were that of a madman, some written in blood, others talking about the end of times. Few were substantiated.

Recent Activity

The Cult of Alistair has long been thought extinct. Generations have passed and nothing but tales have captured the imaginations of the populous. However, recent reports have placed them in the northern mountains once again.
